intro: Vincetoxicum flavum, commonly known as yellow woodbine, is a deciduous flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its stems are woody and often have a reddish-brown hue, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Vincetoxicum flavum is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, thriving in partial to full shade.
